MacTech: Magazine, Web, and Live Events

As publisher and editor-in-chief of MacTech Magazine, Neil created a new direction for the magazine, bringing with it a new look and feel.  Now, MacTech Magazine is the journal of Macintosh technology.The publication strives to provide the Macintosh technical community withfocused, current and practical information that will enable them tomaximize productivity.

Xplain Corporation has experience in magazine publishing, both for itself and other companies, as well as in the high-tech mail order industry.  It's focus today is on MacTech Magazine, providing turnkey publishing services, as well as organizing pavilions and special interest areas at trade shows.

Summer Camp, Philmont, and more.  Troop 485 in Westlake Village has been an awesome scouting experience.Lead a group of 35 to the 2010 Boy Scout National Jamboree at Fort A.P. Hill, Virginia to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Boy Scouts of America.

In June 2008, Las Virgenes Unified School District determined that it needed a comprehensive Technology Strategy. Primarily funded by the Las Virgenes Educational Foundation, combined with donated services, the process included hundreds of hours of interviews with teachers, staff, administrators, parents, students and community members. Unlike most reports the District receives, the goal and methodology of the project was to assist the District in creating a strategy, rather than just make recommendations.The result is a 198-page document giving the background, status, and strategy that is available for public viewing. The Board of Education held a Study Session on October 14th, 2009 to review the document. The 5 main points of the strategy are outlined in the executive summary. For information, comments, and testimonials on this project, see http://www.xplain.com/lvusd

Member of the Board of Directors

Cabrillo Music Theatre is the Ovation Award-winning Resident Musical Theatre Production Company of the Thousand Oaks Civic Arts Plaza, and a non-profit theatre organization. For over three decades, Cabrillo has been enriching the cultural life of Ventura and Los Angeles Counties and the surrounding areas by providing an extraordinary performing arts experience through live, Broadway-quality productions of musical theatre. It is Cabrillo's mission to provide the highest quality musical experience, to foster educational opportunities, and to promote cultural and artistic enrichment to enhance the quality of life in Southern California. By creating opportunity for up-and-coming performers and artists, Cabrillo has launched hundreds to success in theatre, movies, television and music, including Adam Lambert, Katharine McPhee, and Tony nominee Stephanie J. Block. In addition, Cabrillo Music Theatre goes "Beyond the Footlights" with Outreach programs to give back to the community, and to provide enhanced theatre experiences for all audiences. Since the inception of "Beyond the Footlights", over 40,000 underserved children, in-need seniors, and active military have enjoyed Cabrillo Music Theatre's productions at no charge. In addition, Cabrillo provides ASL signed performances of every production; talkbacks with cast and staff; and Cabrillo's Animal Rescue program, which raises funds and awareness for homeless and abused dogs and cats.

Mark A. Lester
Managing Partner at Jones & Lester, LLP
February 2, 2011, Neil worked with Mark A. in the same group

One of the most effective, motivated and motivating scout leaders I’ve ever been around. He always led by example and never asked something of anyone he wasn’t prepared to do himself. His ability to multi-task effectively is unparalleled. He anticipated issues and problems, in most instances before they even arose, so that solutions were quickly implemented. He was a team player throughout the process and ALWAYS had the boys’ best interests as the focus of any decision he made. He was able to reach through to scouts who were having issues in such an effective manner that problems were solved, and the issues did not affect (or only had limited effect on) the rest of the scouts in the troop. Because of his extraordinary efforts and dedication, each of the scouts had a wonderful and safe time at the Jamboree, which was expressed time and again by the scouts and parents at our court of honor.  Without his efforts, I do not believe that would have been the case for Troop 831 and I would have had concerns about the welfare of the troop and the trip as a whole.
